titleStmt.title: The Kings Maiesties resolvtion concerning Robert Earl of Warwicke, Lord Admirall of His Majesties navie royall, wherein is declared the Kings full resolution and intention concerning his navie, now lying upon the downs. : With the Earl of Warwicks declaration to both Houses of Parliament, and the oath taken by all his captains, lieutenants, and other inferiour officers, under his command, belonging to the fleet. : Also the proceedings of the Earl of Warwicke and Sir Iohn Pennington, lying neer to the said Earl with a great number of cavaleers near the downs : ... whereunto is annexed, exceeding joyfull newes from Ireland, being the copy of a letter read in the House of Commons on Saturday last, Iuly the 8.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Christ Church (University of Oxford). Library.
